Even though the fixed-position element's container is nonscrollable, it should still be composited because one of its ancestors is scrolling.

{
  "layers": [
    {
      "name": "LayoutView #document",
      "bounds": [800, 600],
      "contentsOpaque": true,
      "drawsContent": true
    },
    {
      "name": "LayoutBlockFlow DIV class='scrollable bigBox'",
      "position": [8, 72],
      "bounds": [302, 302],
      "drawsContent": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Scrolling Layer",
      "position": [9, 73],
      "bounds": [285, 285]
    },
    {
      "name": "Scrolling Contents Layer",
      "position": [9, 73],
      "bounds": [285, 800],
      "drawsContent": true
    },
    {
      "name": "Overflow Controls Host Layer",
      "position": [8, 72],
      "bounds": [302, 302]
    },
    {
      "name": "Horizontal Scrollbar Layer",
      "position": [9, 358],
      "bounds": [285, 15]
    },
    {
      "name": "Vertical Scrollbar Layer",
      "position": [294, 73],
      "bounds": [15, 285]
    },
    {
      "name": "Scroll Corner Layer",
      "position": [294, 358],
      "bounds": [15, 15],
      "drawsContent": true
    },
    {
      "name": "LayoutBlockFlow (positioned) DIV class='fixed lime box'",
      "position": [10, 100],
      "bounds": [100, 100],
      "contentsOpaque": true,
      "drawsContent": true,
      "backgroundColor": "#00FF00"
    }
  ]
}
